title: after update thunderbird forgets open emails
content:
I leave e-mails that I am currently actively working on/interested in open when I close my Thunderbird session. When I start my next Thunderbird session those e-mails re-open.

After the each of the past few Thunderbird updates (I am not using version 115.5.0) I have found that, when starting Thunderbird, there are tabs for the previously open e-mails, but the tabs are completely blank. There is nothing to indicate what was previously open.

1) Can I recover a list of the e-mails that were previously open? 2) Can this be fixed in future releases so that this information is not lost upon another update?
creator: anzucker

title: Thunderbird freezes and lags constantly (Ubuntu)
content:
greetings, Thunderbird not acting right! When I try to delete something or just click on an item it takes a few seconds before any action. Something is broken, and it wasn't like that just recently. At first I thought it might be me, but it's not. I checked, and my system (Acer Aspire TC 1760) is running flawlessly.

Something is broken with Thunderbird. I sincerely hope this is fixed, as this problem is very frustrating, and I won't be able to put up with it much longer.

I am actually a paying member....yes,I've been using TB exclusively since the my early days with Linux (long ago). I would hate to switch to a different Email at this point. PLEASE HELP!!!

Maybe a coding change? Only the coders can answer that.

A long time and hopefully a continuing user, 

joe
creator: joe.dee

title: Some messages don't get marked "read" for a long time after opening
content:
Hi. I'm using T-bird v 115.3.2, and since the upgrade to 115, I've been seeing weird behavior regarding opening messages vs their getting marked read.

I'm referring to actually opening the message in a new window (I do not use the preview window--it is turned off).

My usual reading behavior is to open a message, read it, then press <F> to go to the next message. In either case, most messages immediately get marked as read. However, some random messages do not get marked as read immediately--after a delay, the message gets marked as read. It seems to be related to messages from some specific senders, as opposed to random messages. For example, marketing messages from Southwest Airlines always seem to have this issue, as do the daily newsletters from "The Hustle."

What are the criteria for T-bird to think a message has been read? If it matters, I'm seeing this on mailboxes where I use IMAP access. I have not seen it occur in the mailbox where I use POP3 access, but almost all of those messages are plain text.
creator: MikeyinCVCA

title: Satır Araları Boşlukları
content:

title: İmza - Sayfa Sonuna atması
content:
Merhaba,

İmza'mı sisteme yüklediğim zaman, imzamı benim mesajımın sonuna atmasını bekler iken, sayfanın en sonuna atıyor. Bunu ayarlamanın bir yolu var mı?

Örneğin; Bana gelen "BBBBBBB" yazısı var. Ben "AAAAAA" yazısı yazıyorum.

Olması gereken; AAAAAA imzam BBBBBB

Fakat olan; AAAAAA BBBBBB imzam

Çözümünü bulamadım, sanırım çözümü yok, her seferinde imzamı, kopyala yapıştır ile mesajımın sonuna ekliyorum.

Yardımlarınız ve görüşleriniz için şimdiden teşekkür ederim
creator: mertdoganyardim

title: Signature places at the end of the page
content:
Hello,

When I upload my signature to the system, instead of waiting for it to add my signature to the end of my message, it puts it at the bottom of the page. Is there any way to set this?

For example; There is a "BBBBBBB" text coming to me. I'm writing "AAAAAA" text.

Must be; AAAAAAA my signature BBBBBB

But what happened; AAAAAAA BBBBBB my signature

I couldn't find a solution, I guess there is no solution, I always add my signature to the end of my message by copy-pasting.

Thank you in advance for your help and opinions.
creator: mertdoganyardim

title: External VGA monitor on Mac OS
content:
I am using a MacBook Air M1 connected to an old 1680x1050 external monitor with a VGA cable.

Thundebird is the only app I cannot move to the external monitor because it does not resize/scale itself: when moved to the old monitor it becomes unusable: - it does not scale - scrolling does not work in many UI elements.

I have made plenty of searches and tried the few solutions I have found, but none seem to solve the issue.

Question 1) Is it possible to use Thunderbird in my settings? Question 2) If yes, what do I need to do in order to have the application resize/scale itself?

Attached photos, the one with more than one window is of the external monitor.
creator: lordthistle

title: How can I wrap long lines in plaintext **respecting** the indent?
content:
I want to be able to send plaintext messages with long lines wrapped (eg. 80 characters) while respecting the indent of the line.

I would like to have something along these lines: ``` Some text: 

    - more text more text more text more text more         more text more text more text more text more          more text more text more text more text more

```

I have the settings described here and they work fine to wrap long lines, but not to indent text.

For example, VScode supports this (I add snapshots).

Also, when clicking "Enter" to go to the next line, it would be nice if the new line is indented the same as the previous one, again, as in VScode.
creator: ignacio.heredia.cacha

How solve the problem, and install the newest version of program? I have Win10, and I was trying to use different mouses (on cable, wireless).

Greetings

title: Thunderbird con gmail, impossibile scaricare messaggi POP3
content:
Questo account è configurato in modo identico ad altri 4, tuttavia non si connette a gmail. Al comando di scaricare i messaggi da POP3, appare il popup indicato nell'immagine allegata. Premendo uno qualsiasi dei due pulsanti, la finestra non si chiude mai e lo scaricamento dei messaggi non prosegue. Ribadisco che la configurazione dei diversi account gmail è identica, come è identica l'impostazione dei corrispondenti account gmail.

Spero in un suggerimento da parte vostra, grazie.

Cordiali saluti.
creator: poliplead
